knimeNode.name: Column Selection Widget
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a column selection widget for use in components views. Outputs a string flow variable with the name of the selected column.

intro.p: Creates a column selection widget for use in components views. Outputs a string flow variable with the name of the selected column.

The node supports custom CSS styling. You can simply put CSS rules into a single string and set it as a flow variable 'customCSS' in the node configuration dialog. You will find the list of available classes and their description on our documentation page.

tab.name: Control
tab.option: A descriptive label that will be shown in the view.
Some lines of description that will be shown in the view, for instance by means of a tooltip.
The column that is selected by default.

By default the List component adjusts its height to display all possible choices without a scroll bar. If the setting is enabled, you will be able to limit the number of visible options in case you have too many of them. The setting is available only for List selection type.
A number of options visible in the List component without a vertical scroll bar. Changing this value will also affect the component's height. The setting is available only for List selection type.

tab.name: Re-execution
tab.option: If selected, widget emits reactivity events that trigger the re-execution of downstream nodes in a component composite view when its value changes. It allows users to create interactive Data Apps and visualizations.

ports.inPort: Table containing the columns to be selected.
ports.outPort: Variable output (string) with the selected column name.
